intro: Trichonema croceum, commonly known as the yellow star grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass family members. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Trichonema croceum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
